website_summaries.verdict: Liquid medication that treats parasitic ear infections, especially mites that can result in scratching and discomfort if left untreated.
pros: Formulated with pyrethrin that targets and treats ear mites, a parasite that causes pets to scratch and leads to irritation
Calms symptoms that come with infestations
cons: May not work on major infestations that have led to secondary ear infections
May sting for a few seconds when placed in the ears

customer_reviews.title: Toxic Component
customer_reviews.text: This is NOT a product for cats!!! Pyrethrins (one of the components) are very poisonous to them !! After putting it on my cat ears, he had a very bad reaction and the two veterinarians who saw him told me that Pyrethrins are highly toxic in cats! causing neurological damage that can lead to the death of the animal. This product shouldn't be recommended for cats!!! It is very irresponsible!!!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: My cat stopped scratching immediately. Thank you!
customer_reviews.text: It's only been one day but it's been one day of my cat not scratching her ears! My cat experienced no side effects. I found an easy way to apply the drops. Even wrapped up, my cat wouldn't tolerate counting 10 drops in each ear. So what I did was used scissors to cut off the needles of my diabetic syringes and put the meds in 2 syringes. I wrapped her in a towel and was able to get the syringe deep enough, I think, that it wouldn't be flying out when she shook her head or leaking out. That made it quick and easy.
customer_reviews.author: JoAnn

customer_reviews.title: Huge bottle, pleasant smell
customer_reviews.text: As expected my cat hated being treated with this, but who likes liquid in their ears! It is a very large bottle for a very reasonable price. For comparison, at Walmart you can buy three single doses of ear mite treatment for almost 4 dollars. This bottle is HUGE in comparison and so worth it. Not a factor for me, but worth noting that this treatment also has what I consider to be a very pleasant smell. Would recommend
customer_reviews.author: Abigail

customer_reviews.title: My kitten had a terrible case of ear mites
customer_reviews.text: Everyone told me that over the counter ear mite meds just don't work. Well, I am here to tell you those naysayers were wrong. My kitten had a terrible case of ear mites. Used this product twice a day for a week and it worked!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: ***No More Ear Mites***
customer_reviews.text: Did the 10 or so drops with three day intervals an bingo both the dog an the cat (the kitten had mites to start an because they are in close proximity the dog got 'em too) are now ear mite free. This stuff works folks.
customer_reviews.author: Sam M.

customer_reviews.title: Jack is a very happy good boy!
customer_reviews.text: Used this for my lab mix who had been miserable. Applied using a 1ml syringe with the needle cut off. Squirted half an ml in each ear, then immediately massaged the bases of his ears and turned his head gently side to side. Did this outside and quickly stepped away while he shook his head. After the first application, there was literally instant improvement. I waited 3 days and did one more application. I am happy to report he is no longer scratching his ears or shaking his head. Very impressed and happy with this product. Excellent value for the price!
customer_reviews.author: j watts

customer_reviews.title: WORKS GREAT!
customer_reviews.text: I adopted a kitten from our local human society. Her ears were so nasty, and she had a bad case of ear mites. This stuff works very well. It got rid of them very quickly. You apply it 3 times, every other day. It really does work. I find using cotton balls makes it easier for me...as cats do not want you pouring something in their ears.
customer_reviews.author: KindleFirePrincess

customer_reviews.title: Help your pup and always love them
customer_reviews.text: Will help with head tilt. If they cringe or tilt their head that means they are in pain or have imbalance. Most likely pain. It’s your job to help them with their ears. Every other day treatment. Not every day and your pup will thank you
customer_reviews.author: Jill M. Schave

customer_reviews.title: The scent...ugh
customer_reviews.text: The scent just about slayed me and I don't know how to describe it without being offensive: it reminds me of rose perfume from the 80's. WHY do they make these sort of things scented?! As far as it working or not, I found it to be mediocre...we still needed a rx from the vet to rid my pup of his ear issue.
customer_reviews.author: mad hatter

customer_reviews.title: My cats like this a lot better
customer_reviews.text: My cats like this a lot better than olive oil. It's quick and works quickly. Thank you
customer_reviews.author: Diana M. Smith

customer_reviews.title: Worked great!
customer_reviews.text: Worked great for a rescue kitten we had! It does have strong smell, and seems like potent stuff. We used a towel to hold the kitten, applied drops in one ear and held the ear closed for a few seconds, then covered him up in the towel, so he shook the extra onto a towel. Then we repeated with the second ear. It took about 2 weeks to clear up the ear mites, but it’s also be cause we didn’t apply as often as recommended, due to the young age of the kitten. It was pretty quick to help him stop scratching, thankfully, and before long they were completely gone.
customer_reviews.author: Angela

customer_reviews.title: pet pain
customer_reviews.text: I have 5 cats, one with mites. I followed directions for just a couple of days as it caused awful pain in the cats ears. All the cats. I had to stop it due to cats howling in pain. Switched to another brand and they have been taken care of. Do not give this to your cats
customer_reviews.author: larry

customer_reviews.title: EXTREMELY DANGEROUS POISON to you and your pet
customer_reviews.text: Scary stuff to attempt to apply inside of your dogs ear canal at home. Considering that this is a high concentrate poison and the fact that, if like my dog, yours has ear mites. I did the best I could possibly do to get the suggested amounts of drops for my over 100lb dog and he wasn't having it. Nevermind massaging it down to ensure that it will be effective for the mites. My boy slung his head, shook his ears out, slinging the poison directly into my right eye! BURN, PANIC, COLD WATER, FLUSH MY EYE, OVER AND OVER! BUYER BEWARE! Vets office is not as expensive as the ER or repeated trips to your opthalmologist. Big mistake.
customer_reviews.author: MD L.

customer_reviews.title: Works good! Smelly funky
customer_reviews.text: Works super good! We used as directed on the bottle to treat ear mites in our lab. The product foamed up slightly when you work it into the ear to penetrate the wax, which makes cleanup ofnthe dirty ear very easy. Only compliant is that it smells like portapotty!!! But it works so well I will take the stinky ears for a couple days.
customer_reviews.author: Brianna

customer_reviews.title: Got rid of ear mites in one treatment
customer_reviews.text: My parents purchased three Flemish Giants from a farmer, and they suffered from ear mites and very dirty ears. My parents were using oil to kill off the ear mites, but that can take 3+ weeks. I ordered this product and had it delivered to their home, explaining to my mom that it's great for rabbits as well as cats and dogs. She cleaned the gunk out of the rabbits' ears and used this ear mite treatment. The rabbits had relief immediately, and my mom said she didn't even think she'd have to use it again but decided to apply it one week later just to be on the safe side. They haven't had problems with ear mites since!
customer_reviews.author: J. Cain

customer_reviews.title: Arrived leaking ..
customer_reviews.text: Open the prime bag and got wet, see photo. The plastic the product was in was not sealed and there are many cautions about not getting this one you. Not good. As you can see from the photo the front of the bottle was facing up ... and the directions on the back were soaking wet and torn. No problem I thought I will go look at the picture on amazon and zoom in to read the directions on the back! Oh, no pic of the back with the directions. 1 star. Arrive leaking 0 stars = 1/2 star.
customer_reviews.author: Canmore Group

customer_reviews.title: and it was all great, there was chunks of brown and mites coming ...
customer_reviews.text: I started suing it the other night, and it was all great, there was chunks of brown and mites coming out which was a good thing! but when i did it today, it wasn't a good thing... My cats clean themselves A LOT. I guess the "Miracle Care" got in her mouth and made her mouth starting to foam, i had to wash her mouth out (which wasn't fun) My advice DO NOT USE IT especially if your cat cleans themselves a lot! VERY TOXIC! NOT NATURAL! Read the ingredients!
customer_reviews.author: Dida Boucher

customer_reviews.title: Economical, Easy to Use and it Works!
customer_reviews.text: Very easy to use. He has stopped scratching his ears and shaking his head after 1 treatment. We will continue to use as instructed to be sure the ear mites are gone. Thanks for a great product and saving me a vet bill!
customer_reviews.author: Betty Skinner

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT BUY THIS!!!!
customer_reviews.text: I gave this to my cat and in a half hour he was so lethargic he couldn't move. I rinsed it out and am hoping for the best but it looks like I will have to take him to the emergency vet.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Does Not Work
customer_reviews.text: Put on my 6 months old kitten's ears twice. Each time after applying, he got foaming in his mouth and looked sick for 24 hours. I think it is toxic. There was more black debris in the ears than before applying. Now the cat runs away as soon as he sees me. I would not recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: E. Lee

customer_reviews.title: This product doesn't work
customer_reviews.text: I have used this product 5 times in 2 weeks, on my puppy and it DID NOT work at all.. please don't waste your money.. i ended up looking online and used a home remedy of baby oil on a q-tip n rub it in his ears n they are now GONE!!
customer_reviews.author: Wendy Wink

customer_reviews.title: To be honest...
customer_reviews.text: Pretty pissed off some of it came out due to the nozzle having issues. Would’ve never happened if the bottle was sealed with foil! I posted a video to show the nozzle was completely turned closed and it still leaks due to the top. I wanna say a good 1.5 ounces came out and was in the bag. As soon as I opened the Amazon package bag it just smelled like it leaked and it did. Just used it on my dogs ears, I’ll edit this review to share if it worked or not.
customer_reviews.author: Kim

customer_reviews.title: Finally a product that works!
customer_reviews.text: My cat had a bad case of ear mites and after using multiple mainstream products from Amazon, I decided to give this a go. I'm so happy I did! I gave my cat 3 applications and he hasn't had ear mites since. It worked much fasted than expected.
customer_reviews.author: Skulleigh

customer_reviews.title: Would’ve been a 5 star product but...
customer_reviews.text: This is product works well but I have ordered it twice now and both times the bottle was partially opened and most of the product has spilled out all over the packaging. I will not purchase again due to the spillage, it is a waste of money, time and product if the product isn’t package properly and ends up spilling out!

customer_reviews.title: ... doses knocked them right out of my kitties ears like magic. She was very upset about the treatment
customer_reviews.text: 2 doses knocked them right out of my kitties ears like magic. She was very upset about the treatment, but is very relieved to not have buggies. 10/10 would recommend. Cheap and way cheaper than a veterinarian

customer_reviews.title: Was quickly delivered. Had an O. K. ...
customer_reviews.text: Was quickly delivered. Had an O.K. aroma. Turned out that the cat did not have ear mites, so I really can't state if it works or not. It is poison, however, so I was concerned about my two cleaning each other. I would check with the vet before using this again.
customer_reviews.author: lovelyllama

customer_reviews.title: I'm sure it works...no clue though
customer_reviews.text: Maybe it was me, maybe it was my doggo. Turns out it wasnt the beginning of ear mites. Just a floppy eared infection. Turns out this made his infection worse :,( My doodle is OK now, but if you're unsure if its ear mites or an ear infection just go to the Vet. Hated to hear my baby scream and cry when he itched his ears.
customer_reviews.author: Crystal J Ortiz

customer_reviews.title: and when the animals shook their heads it went everywhere and was not so easy to clean up
customer_reviews.text: It was oily, and when the animals shook their heads it went everywhere and was not so easy to clean up. I would not buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Avril

customer_reviews.title: Worthless
customer_reviews.text: After weeks of use this has done nothing but torture and torment my cat. Absolutely zero help with mites. Smells fine i guess. I feel ripped off. Do not buy!

customer_reviews.title: Works well and is a good price
customer_reviews.text: This worked right away for our new kitten as soon as we started using it for a day or two to cure ear mites.you may need to scruff your cat to make this easier to put in their ears because at least with our cat they acted like we were killing her trying to put this in her ears.

customer_reviews.title: Solved the problem
customer_reviews.text: This seems to have cleared up the itch in my dog's ears in about 3 days. It smells like strong bug spray, but it works and that's all I was worried about. I was wishing I had bought one of the ones with aloe when I first tried it, because of the smell. But the black matter in her ears has gotten better.
customer_reviews.author: L. Sims

customer_reviews.title: New bottle needed but helped my cat overall
customer_reviews.text: I found the only possible way to get this into my cats ears without pouring way too much was to put it into a different container. I used an old eye drop container. Other than that, this helped my cats ears a lot. I think if I had followed the directions on how often to give it *exactly* that it would be completely gone. I’m still working on getting rid of the mites but I can really see a difference with this medicine. Just make sure to be consistent.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: It works
customer_reviews.text: It does work great, and is easy to use, the only reason I give 4 stars is because the expiration date has been rubbed off of my bottle. Which makes it worrisome and I don't know how long I will be able to use this for.
customer_reviews.author: GMSqueaky

customer_reviews.title: Good
customer_reviews.text: It seems to work, which is the main thing. I deducted one star because the smell is very powerful.
customer_reviews.author: John Hendrix

customer_reviews.title: Cleared my cats ear mites right up. We put ...
customer_reviews.text: Cleared my cats ear mites right up. We put this treatment in her ears every 2-3 days for two weeks, pouring in a few drops, and massaging the ear canal. We alternated with a regular ear cleaning solution, not sure if that helped as well, but she had scratched a lot and had little scabs that were bleeding, so I wanted to make sure her ears stayed clean.
customer_reviews.author: Susan

customer_reviews.title: No More Whining
customer_reviews.text: My dog was having issues with his ears. I am babysitting him for a year while is mommy is on deployment. He was scratching at them and whining. I knew it had to be miserable, so I started doing research. The research led me to this product and I thought to try it. I did not want to go to the vet because of time and expense. Not an easy call because I wanted comfort for my dog. I received the product the in 2 days and began treatment. There is no more whining and scratching. His leg does not kick when I touch his ears. I guessed right with this product and recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Chris O

customer_reviews.title: Easy Ear Mite/Ear cleaner all in one!!! LOVE THIS
customer_reviews.text: I have 10+ cats and this makes my life so easy can doctor all of there ears in one setting!!! They work really good with one dose and they clean there ears at the same time!!! YEA!!!

customer_reviews.title: Good stuff
customer_reviews.text: I had previously bought this at a local farm store, but ran out. I like the new bottle nozzle better than the original. It makes it easier to use IMO. My bunnies are grateful...

It really stank bad after it was in his ear with the ear mites and wax and it made me gag to clean it out afterwards but that's not the product, that's just because it was working.

It just kept squirting out from under the lid getting all over the place... Not happy with product

customer_reviews.title: Works for mild cases

customer_reviews.text: It was difficult to administer mainly because cats don’t like to be given anything in their ears, but with the use of a soft cloth to protect their eyes and clear out the dead mites after, it worked within a single use.

customer_reviews.title: I didn't want to waste my money on the vet
customer_reviews.text: I didn't want to waste my money on the vet, so I tried this on my dog and her ears have gotten much better. I honestly don't really like the smell. It was a bit too strong for me. But it wasn't a big deal.

customer_reviews.title: TOXIC TO CATS
customer_reviews.text: This medication is advertised for cats and dogs, but it has ingredients that are toxic to a cats nervous system: Pyrethins! And the ear wash has Eucalyptus oil!! My cat had severe diarrhea after I gave this to her. Please do not buy for cats. Use diatomaceous earth, or get a medication from the vet.
customer_reviews.author: jenaye

I picked up the bottle with out any gloves and now have a 1st degree chemical burn on my hand which doesn't help because I have a new born extremely frustrated.

customer_reviews.title: BOTTLE LEAKAGE

THE PROBLEM was the bottle leaks. It was in an additional plastic bag and that bag had medicine all over inside.

customer_reviews.title: Ear mite med like the vet's
customer_reviews.text: Same stuff my vet uses; however, if the cat's ears are impacted with wax, it's a good idea to have a vet look at the wax under a microscope. My cat had an ear infection along with mites, and this stuff only treats mites. The ear cleaner helped knock loose a lot of junk without causing my cat pain like alcohol might have.

However, he did yelp both times it was applied, therefore, I believe it is painful for him

customer_reviews.author: Pearl Perez

customer_reviews.title: Works very well!
customer_reviews.text: I love this product! It works well as long as you keep up with ear cleaning everyday to get rid of pests/dirty ears! Also, the bottle is bigger than I expected and had a different cap than pictured.
customer_reviews.author: BBrown

customer_reviews.title: FANTASTIC
customer_reviews.text: Works great! My kittens had ear mites and with one treatment the mites were gone!
customer_reviews.author: Billie

customer_reviews.title: Great stuff
customer_reviews.text: After 2 uses and cleaning of ears mites were gone. Still going to use 1 more times just to be on safe side.
customer_reviews.author: Trudy Roller

customer_reviews.title: Do not buy!!!
customer_reviews.text: Was a complete waste of money. I treated my cat 3 times and he still has earmites. It was messy and hard to use as well.
customer_reviews.author: Chella Ciccarelli

customer_reviews.title: Good amount for the price.
customer_reviews.text: Was what was described. Used it once and haven't seen any scratching.
customer_reviews.author: Cherie

customer_reviews.title: Worked for us.
customer_reviews.text: Worked for us. Dog's ears looked much better after a few days and no more head shaking and scratching.
customer_reviews.author: Al

customer_reviews.title: No bottle seal, leaked all over itself.
customer_reviews.text: No seal on the bottle whatsoever, bottle leaked all over itself in the "packaging". 1 star.
customer_reviews.author: JAB

customer_reviews.title: Lacks efficacy
customer_reviews.text: Did not have good results with this product. Finally gave up and used 1 cc of Ivomac mixed into 15 ml bottle of Tresaderm, 2-3 drops twice a day (from the vet)
customer_reviews.author: prommom

customer_reviews.title: It works
customer_reviews.text: Our Germy Shepherd won't let us near her with this. Oh well. I also use it on the rat terrier's feet when he has allergies in the spring.
customer_reviews.author: Cantona Ray Vonn

customer_reviews.title: Works GREAT
customer_reviews.text: This stuff works great for both cat and dog. Keeps them away too. Recommend you buy it.
customer_reviews.author: Sandra

customer_reviews.title: Different than what I ordered
customer_reviews.text: The item I received was completely different in not only appearance, but also the name. It does appear that this item has the same ingredients as the one I ordered, so I decided to keep it. I haven't used to long enough to know how well it works. I just wanted to warn people.
customer_reviews.author: Alis

product_meta.title: Miracle Care R-7M Ear Mite Treatment 4oz
product_meta.description: Size:4 Oz.Miracle Care R-7M Ear Mite Treat for Dogs and Cats is part of R-7's complete ear care product line.
feature_bullets: This Pyrethrin based liquid controls spinose ear ticks and ear mites.
Safe for both dogs and cats and works best with R-7 Ear Cleaner.
Also available in Kit form which includes R-7 Ear Cleaner.
Help you pet get rid of the pesky parasites that can cause itching and inflammation in the ears.
5 inches long , 1 1/2 inches wide, 1 1/2 inches high
Mites are extremely bothersome to your cat or dog
They are itchy and leave a bloody residue behind
Help you pet get rid of the pesky parasites that can cause itching and inflammation in the ears.
5 inches long , 1 1/2 inches wide, 1 1/2 inches high
